statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: G.W. Boon scored 11 points and grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Bucknell over Colgate 77-69 on Sunday, clinching its first outright Patriot League regular season title since 2006.
article.headline: Bucknell tops Colgate to clinch home court throughout Patriot League tournament
article.linkText: Bucknell beats Colgate for Patriot League crown
article.story: HAMILTON, N.Y. -- G.W. Boon scored 11 points and grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Bucknell over Colgate 77-69 on Sunday, clinching its first outright Patriot League regular season title since 2006. The Bison (20-8, 11-1) trailed 43-33 with 18:47 remaining, but a Cameron Ayers' jumper capped a 22-8 run as Bucknell took a 55-51 lead with 11:16 left. Mitch Rolls made two free throws with 35 seconds on the clock, cutting the deficit to 71-69. Bucknell went 6 for 6 from the free-throw line in the final 28 seconds to seal the victory. The win coupled with American University's 64-60 loss to Holy Cross on Sunday, clinched home court advantage throughout the conference tournament for the Bison. Nick Pascale scored 18 points and grabbed 15 rebounds for the Raiders (7-20, 4-8). Joe Hoban added 16 points and Yaw Gyawu 13. Ayers finished with 14 points and Bryson Johnson added 12 for Bucknell.
